auto_follow.description: Whether this request comes as result of auto-follow after clicking on a link. Follow links can be used by partners on their site or in emails. Only selected partners can be followed this way. We verify that partner can be auto-followed.

A CBO campaign automatically generates ad group budgets from its campaign budget to maximize campaign outcome.

pacing_delivery_type.description: Pacing delivery type. With ACCELERATED, an ad group budget is spent as fast as possible. With STANDARD, an ad group budget is spent smoothly over a day.

tracking_urls.description:
Third-party tracking URLs.
JSON object with the format: {"Tracking event enum":[URL string array],...}
For example: {"impression": ["URL1", "URL2"], "click": ["URL1", "URL2", "URL3"]}.
Up to three tracking URLs are supported for each event type. Tracking URLs set at the ad group or pin promotion level can override those set at the campaign level. May be null.

privacy.description:
Board privacy setting - "public", "protected", or "secret".
Public boards are visible to everyone and can appear in all searches.
Protected boards live at the very bottom of your profile in a section only visible to you. Pins on a protected board may surface in search results and others' home feeds, but others can only access the protected board if they have a direct link.
Secret pins and boards won't appear in your home feed, in search, or anywhere else around Pinterest.

For example, if an advertiser adds a user and this field increases by 1,they will know the email is associated with a Pinterest account.

video_status.description:
Status of newly-created video pin. Video pins need to go through an approval process.


Note: Video transcoding, also called video encoding, is the process that converts a video file from one format to another, to make videos viewable across different platforms and devices.

ValueDescription
1Processing. Transcoding is underway to optimize the video for playing on Pinterest.
2Processing failed. Indicates a failure, typically in transcoding, and, in this case, no one, including the uploader, can view the video. The pin create call is deactivated.
3Reviewing. Video is in Pinterests internal review queue. At this time, only uploader/pin owner can view the video pin.
4Reviewing failed. Internal review has rejected the video, possibly for objectionable content. In this case, only the owner can view the video.
5Success. Video has passed review and can be seen on Pinterest.

PinterestTagEventData.description:
Optional for VISITOR `audience_type`. With the Pinterest tag, you can use event data to capture event details from your website. This object lists all the available predefined event data fields in the Pinterest tag. You can include these event data fields as part of a VISITOR audiences `rule`; however, you **must** specify an `event` for the `event_data` fields to be evaluated. Besides whats listed, you can also create your own set of `event_data` fields and define their usages or purposes according to your website needs. However, the benefit of using the predefined event data fields is that we can provide various metrics based on those fields' data.
Examples per `event` type:
`pagevisit`
"event_data": { "page_name": "My online store 123 | view items | shoe" }
`signup`
"event_data": { "lead_type": "New release promotion" }
`checkout`
"event_data": { "value": 116, "order_quantity": 2, "currency": "USD", "line_items": [ { "product_name": "Pillows (Set of 2)", "product_id": "11", "product_price": 48, "product_quantity": 1 }, { "product_name": "Pillows, Large (Set of 2)", "product_id": "15", "product_price": 68, "product_quantity": 1 } ] }
`addtocart`
"event_data": { "value": 499, "order_quantity": 1, "currency": "USD", "line_items": [ { "product_name": "Red leather boots", "product_id": "3486", "product_category": "shoe", "product_variant_id": "JB11103000", "product_price": 499, "product_quantity": "1", "product_brand": "My brand" }]}
`watchvideo`
"event_data": { "video_title": "My Product Video 01" }
`lead`
"event_data": { "lead_type": "Newsletter" }

page_name.description: Page name. For example, 'Our Favorite Pins on Pinterest'.

video_title.description: Video title. For example, 'How to style your Parker Boots'.

height.description:
Pin promotion preview height.
-1 = invalid or non-existent image.
May overestimate height by 10-50 pixels.

url.description:
Preview URL, expires in 24 hours. Can be used in an iframe.
For example: https://ads.pinterest.com/ad-preview/74667c814dd2b19/
The preview object ID/key is the last param - 74667c814dd2b19

included.description: True if group is BIDDABLE, false if it should be EXCLUDED from serving ads.

product_group_type.description: Is product group a tree leaf or node?

relative_definition.description: Product group definition relative to its parent - an attribute name/value pair.

valid.description: True = product group in use, false = deleted.

filters.description: Mapping of filters to product ordinals. e.g., { '1': [ 'sku1017638']}.  1=ITEM_ID, 2=AVAILABILITY, 3=BRAND, 4=CONDITION, 5-11=GOOGLE_PRODUCT_CATEGORY_0-6, 12-16=PRODUCT_TYPE_0-4, 17-21=CUSTOM_LABEL_0-4, 22=MIN_PRICE, 23=MAX_PRICE

collections_hero_pin_id.description: Collections hero pin ID. A collections ad is an ad format that appears as a combination of one large, hero image followed by three smaller, secondary images. The main image is known as the hero creative and the smaller, secondary images are known as the secondary creatives. Collections ads appear in the Pinterest mobile feed. For more information, see Collections ads on Pinterest.

id.description: First input term. For example, if you pass "?terms=clothes,workout", then id will be "clothes".

related_term_count.description: Total number of related terms returned.

related_terms_list.description:
Related terms object array.
For example: [{"term": "workout", "relatedTerms": ["yoga workout", "arm workout", "one song workout","ab workout", "workout plan", "workout motivation", "workout clothes"]},...]

Rule.description:
JSON object defining targeted audience users. Example rule formats per audience type:
CUSTOMER_LIST: { "customer_list_id": "<customer list ID>"}
ACTALIKE: { "seed_id": ["<audience ID>"], "country": "US", "percentage": "10" }
(Valid countries include: "US", "CA", and "GB". Percentage should be 1-10.
The targeted audience should be this % size across Pinterest.)
VISITOR: { "visitor_source_id": ["<conversion tag ID>"], "retention_days": "180", "event_source": {"=": ["web", "mobile"]}, "ingestion_source": {"=": ["tag"]}}
(Retention days should be 1-540. Retention applies to specific customers.)
ENGAGEMENT: {"engagement_domain": "www.entomi.com", "prefill": false, "retention_days": 30}
(If prefill is false, no user engagements prior to list creation are counted.)

engagement_domain.description: The audience account's verified domain. **Required** for ENGAGEMENT `audience_type`.

engagement_type.description: Engagement type enum. Optional for ENGAGEMENT `audience_type`. Supported values are `click`, `save`, `closeup`, `comment` and `like`. All engagements are included if this field is not set.

event.description: A Pinterest tag event. Optional for VISITOR `audience_type`. Possible values are `pagevisit`, `signup`, `checkout`, `viewcategory`, `search`, `addtocart`, `watchvideo`, `lead`, and `custom`. This field also accepts a partner-defined Pinterest tag event.

percentage.description: Percentage should be 1-10. The targeted audience should be this % size across Pinterest.

pin_id.description: IDs of engaged organic pins. Optional for ENGAGEMENT `audience_type`. For example, '"pin_id:": ["34567"]'

prefill.description: Optional for ENGAGEMENT or VISITOR `audience_type`. If `true`, the specified rule on existing engagement data is applied to pre-populate the audience. If `false`, the audience is empty at creation time. The default is `true`.

retention_days.description: Number of days a Pinterest user remains in the audience. Optional for ENGAGEMENT and VISITOR `audience_type`. Accepted range is 1-540. Defaults to 180 if not specified.

url.description:
Optional for ENGAGEMENT or VISITOR `audience_type`. For ENGAGEMENT, it is the engaged pin's URL. For VISITOR, you can use it as a string or a {operator: value} object for filtering visitors based on conversion tag event URLs. Supported operators are [ =, !=, contains, not_contains].
Example 1: "url": "http://www.myonlinestore123.com/view_item/shoe"
Example 2: "url": '{"contains": "/view_item/shoe"}'

visitor_source_id.description: The conversion tag ID, or the Pinterest tag ID, that you use on your website. For VISITOR `audience_type`.

days_of_the_week.description: Days of the week when report runs.

engagement_window_days.description: Number of days to use as the conversion attribution window for an engagement action. Engagements include saves, closeups, link clicks, and carousel card swipes. Applies to Pinterest Tag conversion metrics. Prior conversion tags use their defined attribution windows. Values: 0,1,7,14,30,60.

filters_json.description:
JSON filter objects to apply to report data. Object format:
{
    "field": Metric column,
    "operator": Row filter operator to apply - "=", "!=", "in", or "not_in",
    "value": A single element, or list, of values to be used when determining
        whether a row passes the filter. Can also be one or more enum strings:
        "APPROVED", "PAUSED", "COMPLETED", "PENDING", "ARCHIVED",
        "REJECTED"
}
Examples:
     [{"field": "SPEND_IN_DOLLAR", "operator": "in", "value": [10, 15]}]
     [{"field": "PIN_PROMOTION_STATUS","operator": "!=", "value": "PAUSED"}]

report_end_relative_days_in_past.description: Number of days prior to delivery date when report ends.

report_start_relative_days_in_past.description: Number of days prior to delivery date when report starts.

report_template_id.description: ID of report template used to generate report.

updated_time.description: Last update time. Unix timestamp in seconds.

user_id.description: ID of user who owns report.

view_window_days.description: Number of days to use as the conversion attribution window for a view action. Applies to Pinterest Tag conversion metrics. Prior conversion tags use their defined attribution windows.  Values: 0,1,7,14,30,60.

TargetingSpec.description: A string containing a JSON object defining the ad group target audience. For example, '{"APPTYPE":["iphone"], "GENDER":["male"], "LOCALE":["en-US"], "LOCATION":["501"], "AGE_BUCKET":["25-34"]}'

AGE_BUCKET.description: Only available in English speaking countries: United States, Canada, United Kingdom, Ireland, New Zealand, and Australia. Values: ["18-24","21+","25-34","35-44","45-49","50-54","55-64","65+"]

AUDIENCE_EXCLUDE.description: Excluded customer list IDs. Used to drive new customer acquisition goals. For example: ["2542620905475"]. Audience lists need to have at least 100 people with Pinterest accounts in them.

AUDIENCE_INCLUDE.description: Targeted customer list IDs. For example: ["2542620905473"]. Audience lists need to have at least 100 people with Pinterest accounts in them

GEO.description: Location region codes, e.g., "BE-VOV" (East Flanders, Belgium) For complete list, click here. Only Location-Region codes apply. Use either GEO or LOCATION but not both.

LOCALE.description: 24 ISO 639-1 two letter language codes. Values: ["cs","da","de","el","en","es","fi","fr","hu","id","in","it","ja","ko","no","pl","pt","ro","ru","sk", "sv","tr","uk","zh"]

LOCATION.description: 22 ISO Alpha 2 two letter country codes or US Nielsen DMA (Designated Market Area) codes (location region codes) (e.g., ["US", "807"]). Use either LOCATION or GEO, but not both. For complete list, click here. Location-Country and Location-Metro codes apply.

hasAccepted.description: Whether the advertiser has accepted or not

status.description: Upload status. Occurs in this order : 'registered' > 'processing' > 'succeeded' or 'failed'. When 'succeeded', it is available for pin creation.

upload_id.description: The ID to track upload progress.

upload_url.description: The URL where you can POST your media content. You have 60 minutes to upload a file and only one successful upload is allowed.

subtitle.example: You will be notified once content is live

clickWindowDays.description: The number of days to use as the conversion attribution window for a 'click' action. Only applies to the conversion metrics returned from the Pinterest Tag. The conversion metrics from conversion tags prior to the Pinterest Tag will still use the attribution windows defined on those conversion tags. If not specified, defaults to 30 days. Values: 0,1,7,14,30,60.

engagementWindowDays.description: The number of days to use as the conversion attribution window for an engagement (i.e. save) action. Only applies to the conversion metrics returned from the Pinterest Tag. The conversion metrics from conversion tags prior to the Pinterest Tag will still use the attribution windows defined on those conversion tags. If not specified, defaults to 30 days. Values: 0,1,7,14,30,60.

viewWindowDays.description: The number of days to use as the conversion attribution window for a 'view' action. Only applies to the conversion metrics returned from the Pinterest Tag. The conversion metrics from conversion tags prior to the Pinterest Tag will still use the attribution windows defined on those conversion tags. If not specified, defaults to 1 day. Values: 0,1,7,14,30,60.

conversionEvent.description: Conversion event enum string. Conversion event against which optimization is performed. Either CHECKOUT, ADD_TO_CART, SIGNUP, LEAD, or APP_INSTALL.

conversionTagId.description: Pinterest v3 tag ID belonging to your ad account to optimize for. Required if conversionEvent is either CHECKOUT, ADD_TO_CART, SIGNUP, or LEAD. Not required for APP_INSTALL.

cpaGoalValueInMicroCurrency.description: Average Target CPA goal in microcurrency (one-millionth) of the ad account currency. For USD, 1/10,000 of a cent. ) When creating an ad group, this field is required for the following objective_type/billable_event combinations: WEB_CONVERSION/IMPRESSION, CATALOG_SALES/IMPRESSION.

frequency.description: Number of impressions per user hoping to achieve.

scopes.read_advertisers: See your advertising profile and settings
scopes.read_boards: See all your boards (including secret boards and group boards you join)
scopes.read_campaigns: See data on your ad campaigns, including spend, budget, and performance
scopes.read_domains: Get your website's most clicked Pins, see the top Pins people are saving and more
scopes.read_merchants: See your Catalog (aka your shopping feed)
scopes.read_pin_promotions: See your ads and ad creative
scopes.read_pins: See all your Pins and comments
scopes.read_users: See users public data (including boards, following, profile etc.)
scopes.write_advertisers: Create and manage your advertising profile
scopes.write_boards: Create new boards for you, and change your board settings
scopes.write_campaigns: Create and manage your ad campaigns
scopes.write_merchants: Manage your Catalog (aka your shopping feed)
scopes.write_pin_promotions: Create and manage ads and ad creative
scopes.write_users: Change user's following boards, Pins and users

{"status": "success", "code": 0, "data": {"pin_count": 2, "type": "board_section", 
"id": "5105616424764748200", "board": {"id": "<board ID>"}, 
"title": "My New Section"}, "message": "ok", "endpoint_name": "v3_create_section"}

preselected_pins.description: Pre-selected pin IDs suggested for this board section.

event_date.description: Event date (UTC). Boards can be used to promote events. Format: YYYY-MM-DD

initial_pin_client_tracking_params.description: Comma separated client tracking params. go/tracking-params.

privacy.description:
Board privacy settings.
Public boards are visible to everyone and can appear in all searches.
Protected boards live at the very bottom of your profile in a section only visible to you. Pins on a protected board may surface in search results and others' home feeds, but others can only access the protected board if they have a direct link.
Secret pins and boards won't appear in your home feed, in search, or anywhere else around Pinterest.

return_existing.description: If a board exists with the same slug for the user, return it. A URL slug is the part of a URL or link that comes after the domain extension. In rebrandly.rocks/content-curation - 'content-curation' is the URL slug.

post.description:
Register your media and upload it to Pinterest AWS cloud storage. This is a two-call process as described here. The first step in uploading media content to Pinterest is registering it.


Note: This endpoint is only available to pinner apps approved for access.


Returns (register call):

An upload media object (see object documentation under Responses > 200 Success > data below).


Register sample call:

curl -X POST https://.../media/uploads/register/
     -H 'Authorization: Bearer <Your API token>'
     -d 'type=video'

Following this call, using the object fields that came back, you can upload your media to Pinterest's Amazon Web Service (AWS) storage in the cloud, using the following POST call:

curl -X POST https://pinterest-media-upload.s3.amazonaws.com/ 
     -F Content-type=multipart/form-data
     -F x-amz-credential=<x-amz-credential>
     -F policy=<policy>
     -F x-amz-security-token=<x-amz-security-token>
     -F x-amz-signature=<x-amz-signature>
     -F key=<key>
     -F x-amz-date=<x-amz-date>
     -F x-amz-algorithm=<x-amz-algorithm>
     -F file=<file>

Note that you shouldn't include your standard authorization header - "-H 'Authorization: Bearer <Your API token>'". If you do, you will see an 'Unsupported Authorization Type' error message.


Sample upload call: (minus the policy and token fields which are very long but formatted the same as the other fields).

curl -X POST https://pinterest-media-upload.s3.amazonaws.com/
     -F Content-type=multipart/form-data
     -F x-amz-credential=ASIA6QZJ64OPPASSKXE2/20200407/us-east-1/s3/aws4_request
     -F policy=<policy>
     -F x-amz-security-token=<x-amz-security-token>
     -F x-amz-signature=a8584b6d2fdb15358112424b5bb3d5a9cc2e741c7cbe5dff0b5cbb9d3dc6c237
     -F key=uploads/aa/69/54/2:video:859061835079519614:5092554872228728913
     -F x-amz-date=20200407T212217Z
     -F x-amz-algorithm=AWS4-HMAC-SHA256
     -F file=@/Users/jdoe/Downloads/bet.mp4

If you don't get an immediate confirmation, you can call the following APIs to check your media upload's status:

  • Get media upload status(es) - Get status per upload ID.
  • Get user media upload status(es) - Get status for calling user.

Once an upload has successfully completed, you can create one or more pins for each upload_id. There is no expiration date for successfully uploaded videos, so you can take as long as necessary between uploading and creating a video pin. The key requirement is to pass your upload_id as media_upload_id when creating the pin. For more information, see the Create pin API. For more information on video pins, click here.

rotation.description: The correct video rotation. AWS (Amazon Web Services) does not always return the correct rotation.

type.description: Media type to upload. Just video for now.

curl -X PUT .../pincarousel/images/upload/ -H 'Authorization: Bearer <Your API token>'

    %2Fart%2FPeopleDiving.jpg'

Sample return (for sample call):

{"status": "success", "message": "ok", "code": 0, "data": [{"image_signature":
"9dffef70bd93035acfa3fe9d17ebdf53", "tracking_id": "5077326030958540552"},
{"image_signature": "2e11dc24894cf9ce8e327e81072e8d6f", "tracking_id": "5077326031998728756"}]}

Sample error return:

url http://www.somewebsite.com/art/HorseBoy.png."}, "message": "Invalid parameters.", "data": null,
"message_detail": "Sorry we could not fetch the image from url http://www.somewebsite.com/art/HorseBoy.png."}

tags.description:
## Welcome to the Pinterest Marketing API. Here you can find guides to accessing our API for your use case, resources for additional learning, and a list of all available endpoints with example requests and responses. Access to our endpoints are grouped based on common use cases. Please reference the section below for the list of features available to your integration. ## Content Without creators and brands, there would be no Pinterest. Thats why we want to make it easier for all creators to publish + manage their Pinterest content through their favorite platforms.
Intended for: Content Platform Companies, Creative Tools, and Creative Production Companies
- [View documentation curated for Content only](/docs/redoc/martech) - [View endpoints available for Content only](/docs/redoc/martech/#tag/aggregated-comments) - [Quick Start: Publish Video](/docs/redoc/martech/#tag/Quick-Start:-Publish-Video) ## Analytics Understand your Pins and what drives the best performance. These endpoints enable you to analyze organic + ads performance as well as obtain your audience insights.
Intended for: BI/Analytic Platform Companies, Creator Platforms, Agencies, and Advertisers
- [View documentation curated for Analytics only](/docs/redoc/combined_reporting) - [View endpoints available for Analytics only](/docs/redoc/combined_reporting/#tag/ad-groups) - [Quick Start: Reporting](/docs/redoc/combined_reporting/#tag/Quick-Start:-Reporting) ## Ads Reach people when they're actively looking for new products and ideas. Turn your Pins into ads to help boost awareness, drive sales or increase conversions.
Intended for: Adtech Platforms, Advertisers, and Creative Production Companies
- [View documentation curated for Ads only](/docs/redoc/adtech) - [View endpoints available for Ads only](/docs/redoc/adtech/#tag/ad-groups) - [Quick Start: Ads Overview](/docs/redoc/adtech/#tag/Quick-Start:-Ads-Overview) ## Pinner Build a consumer application that caters to most Pinners, as opposed to enterprise applications which typically serve businesses and advertisers.
Intended for: Consumer apps, Developer apps
- [View documentation curated for Pinner only](/docs/redoc/pinner_app) - [View endpoints available for Pinner only](/docs/redoc/pinner_app/#tag/board-section) ## Shopping Connect your product catalog feed directly to Pinterest. Our shopping endpoints focus on making it easier for brands to sell on Pinterest.
Intended for: Product Feed Providers, Shoppable Experience Companies, Adtech Platforms
**Please work with your Pinterest contact for relevant docs!** ## Audience Create tailored audiences or connect your ad account with your customer lists. Your audience is on Pinterest, theyre here for new ideas, and theyre looking for brands like yours.
Intended for: Audience Partners
**Please work with your Pinterest contact for relevant docs!** ## Tags and Domain Manage Pinterest tags, domains, and user's websites.
Intended for: Web platform Partners
- [View documentation curated for Tags and Domain only](/docs/redoc/web_platform) - [View endpoints available for Tags and Domain only](/docs/redoc/web_platform/#tag/advertisers) ***
tags.name: Introduction

tags.description:
# User Authorization Access to Pinterest APIs via User Authorization require an authorization flow based on OAuth 2.0. Below are the steps to request an access_token on behalf of the authenticated user.
- 1. Start the OAuth flow (explicit, server side) - 2. Receive access code upon user grant - 3. Exchange the code for an access token - 4. Access tokens and Usage
## Start the OAuth flow (explicit, server side) In order to the start the user authorization process, you must present the authenticated user the OAuth page.
https://www.pinterest.com/oauth
**Note:** The entire OAuth transaction must be performed over HTTPS or the transaction will result in an error. You must submit the following parameters to the OAuth page:
- **client_id:** Your App ID. - **redirect_uri:** A valid redirect URI from your App profile. - **response_type:** Set this value to `code` - **state** (optional): This parameter can be any string value defined by you. This parameter is commonly used to prevent cross-site request forgery. This value is appended to your redirect URI, as part of the request query string, during the OAuth transaction. Here is an example request to the OAuth page:

https://www.pinterest.com/oauth/?client_id={app_id}&redirect_uri={redirect_uri}&response_type=code&state={optional}
#### OAuth dialog If users are logged in, they will see an authorization page where they can approve access for your app:



If they are not logged in, they will be asked to do so before authorizing your app:



**Note:** If you wish to authorize on behalf of a [Linked business account](https://help.pinterest.com/en/business/article/get-a-business-account), be sure to make that account active on [Pinterest](https://www.pinterest.com/) before invoking the OAuth dialog.

#### OAuth dialog errors You may encounter an error page in the event you send a bad request for this step such as an invalid redirect URI or a scope value that is not supported by your App.
**400 Something went wrong!** - Encountered when you provide a `scope` value that is currently not supported by your App.
For more information on proper use of scopes see [OAuth Scopes]("#section/User-Authorization/OAuth-Scopes/")
**400 The provided redirect_uri does not match the registered redirect URI.** - Encountered when the redirect_uri in the request does NOT match any of the redirect URIs in the App profile.
Check the redirect_uri value in the request and ensure it exactly matches a redirect URI in your App profile.
**400 This application has not registered a redirect URI** - Encountered when a redirect URI has not been defined for your App.
[Manage your App]("/manage/") and ensure a redirect URI is defined in your App profile. ## Receive the access code upon user grant Once the user approves authorization for your app, they will be sent to the supplied redirect URI along with the following parameters.
- **code:** This is the `code` you must use in the next step to exchange for an access token. - **state:** This is the optional parameter to prevent cross-site request forgery. Check to make sure it matches what was passed in the first step of the flow. A redirect URI suppplied as `https://www.mydomain.com/callback/` results in the following callback request:

https://www.mydomain.com/callback/?code={code}&state={optional} ## Exchange the code for an access token You must now exchange the received `code` for an `access_token` by making a PUT request to the access token endpoint:
https://api.pinterest.com/v3/oauth/access_token/
The *recommended* authentication approach when calling this endpoint is to use `HTTP Basic Authorization` in your request header, where `username/client_id` is your App ID and `password/client_secret` is your App secret.
Request header:
Authorization: Basic {Base64 encoded client_id:client_secret}
Required parameters:
- **code:** This is the authorization code received from the previous request. - **redirect_uri:** This must be one of the redirect_uris from your App profile. - **grant_type:** Set this value to `authorization_code`
curl -X PUT --url https://api.pinterest.com/v3/oauth/access_token/ --header "Authorization: Basic {base64 encoded client_id:client_secret}" --data "code={CODE}&redirect_uri={redirect_uri}&grant_type=authorization_code"
You can also make an *unauthenticated* PUT request with `client_id` and `client_secret` as **additional** parameters.
curl -X PUT --url https://api.pinterest.com/v3/oauth/access_token/ --data "code={code}&redirect_uri={redirect_uri}&grant_type=authorization_code&client_id={app_id}&client_secret={app_secret}"
If successful, your response will contain an access token with relevant scope information:

{ "status":"success", "message":"ok", "code":0, "data":{ "access_token":"{access_token}", "expires_at":0, "consumer_id":144XXXX, "token_type":"bearer", "authorized":true, "scope":"write_boards,read_pins,write_pins" } }
## Access tokens #### Make an API request You can provide the access token in the request in the following ways.
*recommended*
curl -X GET https://api.pinterest.com/v3/users/me/ --header "Authorization: Bearer {access_token}"
also valid
curl -X GET https://api.pinterest.com/v3/users/me/?access_token={access_token} #### Token expiration The generated token does not expire by default unless the access_token gets invalidated by the user. A user password change will render a token invalid at which point the user will have to re authenticate with your App. Expect a `401` HTTP status and the following in the response. Specifically `code: 2`
{ "status":"failure", "code":2, "data":null, "message":"Authentication failed.", "endpoint_name":"{ENDPOINT_NAME}", "error":{ "message":"None" } } ## OAuth scopes By default when a user grants access to your app you will receive an access token with all possible scopes allowed for your app.
However, you may optionally request only specific scopes (from those allowed by your app) during the OAuth flow using the `scope` parameter.
Here is an example request to the OAuth page requesting specific scopes: https://www.pinterest.com/oauth/?client_id={app_id}&redirect_uri={redirect_uri}&response_type=code&state={optional}&scope=write_boards,read_pins
To understand what scopes your app is allowed to request - you may check the `scopes` field in a successful access token response, see an example response above.
There are two flavors of scopes with our API: **Granular** and **Composite** (newly introduced). Below is the full list of scopes and end-user facing definitions.
**Note:** Your app will NOT have access to ALL of the listed scopes below. We are not supporting requests for additonal scope access at the moment. #### Granular scopes Granular scopes are the most fine grained level of permissions that our API considers during authorization. For example: **read_pins** is a granular scope that covers the ability for an app to get read-only access to a user's pins. | Name | End-user definition | | ------------- | ---------- | | read_domains | Get your website's most clicked Pins, see the top Pins people are saving and more | | read_boards | See all your boards (including secret boards and group boards you join | | write_boards | Create new boards for you, and change your board settings | | read_pins | See all your public Pins and comments | | write_pins | Create new Pins for you | | read_users | See your public data (including boards, following, profile etc.) | | write_users | Change your following boards, Pins and users | | read_secret_boards | See your secret boards | | read_secret_pins | See your secret Pins | | read_user_followers | Access your follows and followers | | write_user_followees | Follow things for you | | read_advertisers | See your advertising profile and settings | | write_advertisers | Create and manage your advertising profile | | read_campaigns | See data on your ad campaigns, including spend, budget, and performance | | write_campaigns | Create and manage your ad campaigns | | read_merchants | See your Catalog (aka your shopping feed) | | write_merchants | Manage your Catalog (aka your shopping feed) | | read_pin_promotions | See your ads and ad creative | | write_pin_promotions | Create and manage ads and ad creative | #### Composite scopes (NEW) Composite scopes are made by combining two or more granular scopes (or even other composite scopes). Composite scopes are intended to simplify the OAuth flow and reduce the number of scopes your app needs to request from users. | Name | Child scopes | End-user definition | | ------------- | ------------ | ---------- | | read_organic | read_boards, read_pins, read_users, read_user_followers, read_domains | See your public data (including boards, Pins, comments, following, followers, and your profile) | | write_organic | write_boards, write_pins, write_users, write_user_followees | Create new Pins and boards for you and update your public data (including boards, Pins, following, followers, and your profile) | | manage_organic | read_organic, write_organic | See, update, and add to your public data (including boards, Pins, comments, following, followers, and your profile) | | read_secret | read_secret_boards, read_secret_pins | See your secret boards and secret Pins | | read_ads | read_advertisers, read_campaigns, read_pin_promotions | See data on your ad campaigns, including spend, budget, and performance | | write_ads | write_advertisers, write_campaigns, write_pin_promotions, write_conversion_event_data | Create and manage your ad campaigns | | manage_ads | write_ads, read_ads | Manage your ad campaigns and see data including spend, budget, and performance | | manage_merchants | read_merchants, write_merchants | See and manage your Catalog (aka your shopping feed) | # Client Authorization **Note:** Only reference this section if your use case calls for Client Authorization. Only a handful of endpoints support Client Authorization. See [User Authorization](#section/User-Authorization) if you are looking for User level grant access.
When opting for Client Authorization, each request must be signed with a signature that originates from a combination of client id, client secret, and timestamp. Each client request to Pinterest must be signed using the OAuth signature algorithm as described in this guide.
- Prepare signature string - Sign the request - Make API request #### Definitions | Name | Definition | | ------------- | ---------- | | HTTP Method | Action to be performed GET, POST, PUT, DELETE | | client_id | Your App ID (e.g 144XXXX) | | client_secret | Your App secret. You can find it at [Manage your App](https://developers.pinterest.com/manage/) | | timestamp | Standard UNIX timestamp (number of seconds since the epoch in UTC). (e.g 1568389554954) | ## Prepare signature string **Example request:**
GET https://api.pinterest.com/v3/users/pintestdeveloperuser/pins/?page_size=10&bookmark=P2MtMXwxNXxhOGViODUzMWE2OGM1OTM2OGVmZDEzYjMxYjhhMDdmMGQ1YTFiZjI1NDVjZWIzNzI3YjgxMTdkNzA0YjRkMjk1fE5FV3w=
1. Start with the capitalized HTTP method
GET
2. URLEncode the URL and PATH
https%3A%2F%2Fapi.pinterest.com%2Fv3%2Fusers%2Fpintestdeveloperuser%2Fpins%2F
3. Append timestamp and client_id to query params
page_size=10&bookmark=P2MtMXwxNXxhOGViODUzMWE2OGM1OTM2OGVmZDEzYjMxYjhhMDdmMGQ1YTFiZjI1NDVjZWIzNzI3YjgxMTdkNzA0YjRkMjk1fE5FV3w=×tamp=1568389554954&client_id=144XXXX
4. Sort All query params (a->z)
bookmark=P2MtMXwxNXxhOGViODUzMWE2OGM1OTM2OGVmZDEzYjMxYjhhMDdmMGQ1YTFiZjI1NDVjZWIzNzI3YjgxMTdkNzA0YjRkMjk1fE5FV3w=&client_id=144XXXX&page_size=10×tamp=1568389554954
5. URLEncode All query param values (values only!)
bookmark=P2MtMXwxNXxhOGViODUzMWE2OGM1OTM2OGVmZDEzYjMxYjhhMDdmMGQ1YTFiZjI1NDVjZWIzNzI3YjgxMTdkNzA0YjRkMjk1fE5FV3w%3D&client_id=144XXXX&page_size=10×tamp=1568389554954
6. Concat steps 1, 2, and 5 using & as a delimiter to create the signature string
GET&https%3A%2F%2Fapi.pinterest.com%2Fv3%2Fusers%2Fpintestdeveloperuser%2Fpins%2F&bookmark=P2MtMXwxNXxhOGViODUzMWE2OGM1OTM2OGVmZDEzYjMxYjhhMDdmMGQ1YTFiZjI1NDVjZWIzNzI3YjgxMTdkNzA0YjRkMjk1fE5FV3w%3D&client_id=144XXXX&page_size=10×tamp=1568389554954 ## Sign the request You must now sign the generated signature string. Below are python and javascript examples on how to sign the request.
#### Python example `sig_string = "GET&https%3A%2F%2Fapi.pinterest.com%2Fv3%2Fusers%2Fpintestdeveloperuser%2Fpins%2F&bookmark=P2MtMXwxNXxhOGViODUzMWE2OGM1OTM2OGVmZDEzYjMxYjhhMDdmMGQ1YTFiZjI1NDVjZWIzNzI3YjgxMTdkNzA0YjRkMjk1fE5FV3w%3D&client_id=144XXXX&page_size=10×tamp=1568389554954"` ##### Create a HMAC-SHA256 instance and initialize it with your App secret `hmac = hmac.new(app_secret, digestmod=hashlib.sha256)` ##### Update the instance with your sig string `hmac.update(sig_string)`
`oauth_sig = hmac.hexdigest()` #### Javascript example `const sig_string = "GET&https%3A%2F%2Fapi.pinterest.com%2Fv3%2Fusers%2Fpintestdeveloperuser%2Fpins%2F&bookmark=P2MtMXwxNXxhOGViODUzMWE2OGM1OTM2OGVmZDEzYjMxYjhhMDdmMGQ1YTFiZjI1NDVjZWIzNzI3YjgxMTdkNzA0YjRkMjk1fE5FV3w%3D&client_id=144XXXX&page_size=10×tamp=1568389554954"` ##### Create a HMAC-SHA256 instance and initialize it with your App secret `let hash = crypto.createHmac('sha256', app_secret);` ##### Update the instance with your sig string `hash.update(sig_string);`
`let oauth_sig = hash.digest(hex);`   ## Make API requests Simply append the oauth_sig as the value to the query parameter oauth_signature. Every request must have a valid oauth_signature that represents the unique request.
https://api.pinterest.com/v3/users/pintestdeveloperuser/pins/?bookmark=P2MtMXwxNXxhOGViODUzMWE2OGM1OTM2OGVmZDEzYjMxYjhhMDdmMGQ1YTFiZjI1NDVjZWIzNzI3YjgxMTdkNzA0YjRkMjk1fE5FV3w=&client_id=144XXXX&page_size=10×tamp=1568389554954&oauth_signature={oauth_sig} ***

You can find it at [Manage your App](https://developers.pinterest.com/manage/) | | timestamp | Standard UNIX timestamp (number of seconds since the epoch in UTC). (e.g 1568389554954) |   ## Preparing signature string ##### Example request: GET https://api.pinterest.com/v3/users/jmejia3964/pins/?page_size=10&bookmark=P2MtMXwxNXxhOGViODUzMWE2OGM1OTM2OGVmZDEzYjMxYjhhMDdmMGQ1YTFiZjI1NDVjZWIzNzI3YjgxMTdkNzA0YjRkMjk1fE5FV3w= 1. Below are python and javascript examples on how to sign the request.
#### Python example `sig_string = "GET&https%3A%2F%2Fapi.pinterest.com%2Fv3%2Fusers%2Fjmejia3964%2Fpins%2F&bookmark=P2MtMXwxNXxhOGViODUzMWE2OGM1OTM2OGVmZDEzYjMxYjhhMDdmMGQ1YTFiZjI1NDVjZWIzNzI3YjgxMTdkNzA0YjRkMjk1fE5FV3w%3D&client_id=144XXXX&page_size=10×tamp=1568389554954"` ##### Create a HMAC-SHA256 instance and initialize it with your secret `hmac = hmac.new(your_client_secret, digestmod=hashlib.sha256)` ##### Update the instance with your sig string `hmac.update(sig_string)`
`oauth_sig = hmac.hexdigest()` #### Javascript example `const sig_string = "GET&https%3A%2F%2Fapi.pinterest.com%2Fv3%2Fusers%2Fjmejia3964%2Fpins%2F&bookmark=P2MtMXwxNXxhOGViODUzMWE2OGM1OTM2OGVmZDEzYjMxYjhhMDdmMGQ1YTFiZjI1NDVjZWIzNzI3YjgxMTdkNzA0YjRkMjk1fE5FV3w%3D&client_id=144XXXX&page_size=10×tamp=1568389554954"` ##### Create a HMAC-SHA256 instance and initialize it with your secret `let hash = crypto.createHmac('sha256', your_client_secret);` ##### Update the instance with your sig string `hash.update(sig_string);`
`let oauth_sig = hash.digest(hex);`   ## Making API requests Simply append the oauth_sig as the value to the query parameter oauth_signature. Every request must have a valid oauth_signature that represents the unique request. https://api.pinterest.com/v3/users/jmejia3964/pins/?bookmark=P2MtMXwxNXxhOGViODUzMWE2OGM1OTM2OGVmZDEzYjMxYjhhMDdmMGQ1YTFiZjI1NDVjZWIzNzI3YjgxMTdkNzA0YjRkMjk1fE5FV3w=&client_id=144XXXX&page_size=10×tamp=1568389554954&oauth_signature={oauth_sig}

tags.description:
You can assign users with different roles and sets of permissions to your account. Currently, you can only do this through the Pinterest Ads Manager. For more information, see Add people to your ad account.


Once you have an API token, you can call the Get advertisers API to get detailed information on a user's account roles and permissions. See this API's documentation for more information. A user's role determines what APIs they can access.

## Implementing account sharing

With account sharing, the account owner grants account access to other users. A user with access can then authorize your app, allowing the app to act on behalf of the original account or the second user.


This implementation has the following benefits:


  • The original account owner shares only the necessary access, e.g., read-only access. The owner does not need to share username/password or log in to the app directly.
  • Username/password resets do not invalidate the shared user's access.

These advantages are especially helpful when:


  • Dealing with large accounts/agencies or users requiring different access levels.
  • Company policy dictates frequent password resets on the owner's part.
Below, you'll find reference information about roles, permissions, and accessible APIs. ## Account roles The following table lists the account roles you can set in the Pinterest Ads Manager. To see the code enums for these roles, click here.
RoleDescription
OwnerCan do everything.
AdminCan add or remove people and create or edit anything in the account such as campaigns, spend limits, bids, budgets, audiences and more. Can do everything an owner can do except change the owner.
AnalystCan only view ad account data to create reports.
Audience ManagerCan create or edit audiences and view existing Pinterest tags.
Finance ManagerCan edit billing information.
Campaign ManagerCan create and edit campaigns, ad groups and Promoted Pins, pull reports, and create and delete Pins on protected boards for promotion purposes.
Catalogs ManagerCan create and edit data source and product group information.
## Role actions Each role is defined with a set of permissable actions. For detailed information, see our Roles and Actions reference document.
tags.name: Account Sharing

tags.description:
## Metrics Pinterest provides many metrics for evaluating advertisers, campaigns, ad groups, keywords, and pin promotions. Here are some things to note about metrics:
  • For a metrics overview, see Pinterest Analytics > Metrics.
  • Code enums for pin metric types can be found here. Enums for video pin metric types can be found here.
  • For metric definitions, call the Get delivery metrics' definitions API endpoint.
  • Targeting delivery metrics are a type of delivery metrics organized around targeting values in ads placement that define your intended audience. A number of ads API calls take a targeting_spec object parameter, which uses these values. Check the documentation for this object for details on each targeting type.

    APIs that take a targeting_spec parameter:
    • Create ad group
    • Update ad group
    • Get bid floors - Get bid floors according to bid floor specifications and targeting specifications.
    • Get bid guidance - Get bid guidance for your pin promotion.
  • Keywords are also a type of targeting but are created and used seperately from other targeting types. See our keyword APIs.
  • Metric names ending in _1 represent first order ad events. For example, CLICKTHROUGH_1 is the number of direct clicks on a Promoted Pin.
  • Metric names ending in _2 represent downstream (earned) events. These are actions taken on saved instances of Promoted Pins. Advertisers are not billed for earned activity.
  • SPEND_IN_MICRO_DOLLAR represents the spend in the micro currency (millionth of a currency unit) of the Advertiser.
  • Metrics that begin with TOTAL refer to conversion data. TOTAL_CONVERSIONS is total number of conversions for the requested reporting period. If you are passing order quantity and order value in Pinterest Tag conversion events, these totals will show in TOTAL_CONVERSIONS_QUANTITY and TOTAL_CONVERSIONS_VALUE_IN_MICRO_DOLLAR.
  • Total conversions, quantity and value are further broken out by different conversion types you may be tracking, as well as attribution types. For example:
    • TOTAL_CLICK_CHECKOUT is the total of click-through conversions of type checkout.
    • TOTAL_VIEW_CHECKOUT is the total of view-through conversions of type checkout.
    • TOTAL_ENGAGEMENT_CHECKOUT_QUANTITY is the total order quantity for engagement-through conversions of type checkout.
    • TOTAL_VIEW_ADD_TO_CART_VALUE_IN_MICRO_DOLLAR is the total order value of view-through conversions of type add to cart.
  • Cross device conversion metrics are available through the fields that have ACTION in their name. For example:
    • TOTAL_VIEW_CATEGORY_MOBILE_ACTION_TO_DESKTOP_CONVERSION is the total for conversions of type view category where the attributed ad event occurred on mobile and the conversion event occurred on desktop.
    • TOTAL_ADD_TO_CART_MOBILE_ACTION_TO_DESKTOP_CONVERSION is the total for conversions of type add to cart where the attributed ad event occurred on mobile and the conversion event occurred on desktop.
  • Beginning in October, 2019, new metrics in the following areas became available:
    • Web conversion metrics
    • In application conversion metrics
    • Offline conversion metrics
    A complete list of these metrics can be found in the documentation for one of our metric APIs, such as Get ad group delivery metrics.
## Metric report types There are two report types available - **synchronous** and **asynchronous**. Synchronous reports are available immediately. Asynchronous reports require setting a batch job in motion where the report is available at a later time.
For both types, the previous days data is available by 6:00 am PST. Synchronous reports also support intraday reporting updates when setting the end date parameter to the current date . Statistics for the current date are updated every hour with a 3 hour lag. Intraday reports include only a subset of metrics and do not include any conversion statistics.
Both types require setting a reporting start date and end date. Optional, but commonly used fields, include setting granularity (e.g, total, daily), attribution windows, and metric columns.
Asynchronous reports give larger advertisers a more efficient way to fetch statistics. For example, you can get performance statistics for all advertiser pin promotions in a single reporting request rather than making multiple single entity reporting requests.
**To request and get an asynchronous report**:
  1. Submit a report request using one of our async report request APIs and receive a batch job token in response.
  2. Check the report's status using the token with one of our get async report APIs. If complete, you get a URL to download the report, good for an hour. Otherwise, you get a "not ready" message. You should poll for completion at intervals of one minute for small requests and five minutes for larger requests (over 10,000 pin promotions).
  3. Once complete, download the report using the response URL.
**Synchronous metric APIs**
  • Get advertiser delivery metrics
  • Get campaign keyword delivery metrics
  • Get ad group delivery metrics
  • Get ad group targeting delivery metrics
  • Get pin promotion delivery metrics
  • Get pin promotion targeting delivery metrics
  • Get country keywords' metrics
  • Get related keywords and metrics per source and country
**Asynchronous metric APIs**
  • Request async advertiser delivery metrics report
  • Get async advertiser delivery metrics report
  • Request async advertiser offline conversion report
  • Get async advertiser offline conversion report

The enums listed here are used when calling or receiving values from API calls. You'll see links to these enums throughout the API documentation.


  • Ad group summary status
  • Bid strategy type
  • Billable event
  • Billing status
  • Billing type
  • Budget type
  • Campaign objective type
  • Campaign summary status
  • Campaign upgrade status
  • Catalog product group type
  • Conversion event
  • Conversion tag type
  • Conversion learning mode type
  • Creative type
  • Entity status
  • Entity type
  • Entity version
  • Match type (keyword)
  • Metric types
  • Mobile measurement partner type
  • Pacing delivery type
  • Pin formats
  • Pin promotion review status
  • Pin promotion status
  • Pinner (audience) list type
  • Placement
  • Placement exclusion
  • Placement group
  • Tracking URL event
  • User list type
  • User role
  • Video pin metric types
  • Visibility group
## Ad group summary status
Value Description
ADVERTISER_DISABLEDAdvertiser disabled ad group.
ARCHIVEDAd group archived.
COMPLETEDAd group has completed.
NOT_STARTEDAd group has not started.
PAUSEDAd group is paused.
RUNNINGAd group is in progress.
 

 

## Bid strategy type
Value Description
AUTOMATIC_BIDAutomatic bidding is only available for traffic campaigns and is the default setting for advertisers running traffic campaigns. Automatic bids are managed by Pinterest instead of you. Bids are updated by Pinterest automatically several times a day. Pinterest aims to get you the most clicks at the lowest possible cost-per-click (CPC) while also spending your entire budget.
MAX_BID Pinterest uses partner's bid in all auctions.
TARGET_AVGPartners provide a CPA (Cost Per Action) and Pinterest bids on their behalf to meet the goal at an average for the entire delivery not for each unit.
 

 

## Billable event
Value Description
IMPRESSION An ad is viewed.
VIDEO_V_50_MRC A video ad is considered having been viewed when 50 percent of its content is on the screen for 2 consecutive seconds, according to the Media Rating Council (MRC)
CLICKTHROUGHAn ad is clicked for more information.
 

 

## Billing status
Value Description
CHARGEBACK Bill was paid, but payment was reversed.
COMPEDRepresents bills with a small spend_in_micro_currency. Bills with status COMPED should not be charged.
FAILED_REFUNDRefunds that failed to be executed.
INTERNALBill is for an internal advertiser who isn't billed.
INVOICEDBill has been invoiced.
NEWInitial state indicating that additional steps must be completed before this bill can be charged (e.g. compute tax). Bills in this state will not be displayed in the billing history. For a newly created refund which has yet to be executed.
NEW_REFUNDFor a newly created refund which has yet to be executed.
PAIDBill has been paid.
PENDINGCredit card payment attempt is in progress.
PENDING_COMPUTE_TAXIndicates that tax should be computed for a bill.
PENDING_GATEWAY_RETRYIndicates that a bill has been scheduled for retries by the payment gateway (for example, by Adyen Auto Rescue).
PENDING_REFUNDRefunds that are in the process of being executed.
PREPAID_FAILED_AUTHPending initial payment of a prepaid billing profile.
PREPAID_OVER_DELIVERY_WRITTEN_OFFWritten off bills to track the over delivery on prepaid credits.
PROCESSINGIndicates that a bill is being processed. Being processed could mean it's being charged, refunded or any other such action is being taken on the bill. This status indicates that the bill should not be picked up for processing and to implement at most once semantics for processing of bills.
PROCESSING_COMPUTE_TAXIndicates that tax is being computed for a bill.
SUCCESSFUL_REFUNDRefunds that have been executed successfully.
UNCOLLECTIBLEUnretriable until billing instrument is updated, e.g. used when CyberSource informs us that a credit card was lost or stolen.
UNPAIDBill is unpaid.
UNRESOLVED_REFUNDRefunds that need to be retried because the original bills were pending.
WRITTEN_OFFUnretriable even if the billing instrument is updated, e.g. an advertiser had a small credit card bill which was not paid and then they moved to invoice, in which case we decide to not charge them the small amount.
WRITTEN_OFF_FOR_FRAUDThese are set when the is_spam field on the advertiser is set to true.
 

 

## Billing type
Value Description
CREDIT_CARD Pay through credit card.
INTERNAL
INVOICE Paid through invoice.
PREPAID Paid ahead of time.
RECURRING Recurring payment.
 

 

## Budget type
Value Description
DAILYAd group's daily spending will not exceed a set budget.
LIFETIMEAd group spending is spaced evenly between a set start and end time.
 

 

## Campaign objective
Value Description
APP_INSTALLOptimize visits to your app's download page or installs of your app.
AWARENESSBrand awareness.
AWARENESS_PREMIUM_RESERVEDReservation brand awareness, premium (deprecated)
AWARENESS_RESERVED Reservation brand awareness (deprecated)
BOARD_ENGAGEMENTBoard engagement.
CATALOG_SALESMaximize catalog sales.
CHECKOUTMaximize checkouts.
CONVERSIONSDrive people to take actions like Checkout, Sign up, or Add to cart on your website.
ENGAGEMENTMaximize engagements such as saves, closeups, comments, link clicks, and carousel card swipes.
TRAFFICMaximize number of visits to your website.
VIDEO_VIEW Optimize the quality of views, average watchtimes, and completion rates to people most likely to view your video.
WEB_CONVERSIONMaximize web conversions events (e.g. checkout, signup).
 

 

## Campaign summary status
Value Description
ADVERTISER_DISABLEDAdvertiser disabled campaign.
ARCHIVEDCampaign archived.
COMPLETEDCampaign has completed.
NOT_STARTEDCampaign has not started.
PAUSEDCampaign is paused.
RUNNINGCampaign is in progress.
 

 

## Campaign upgrade status
Value Description
AD_GROUPS_ENABLEDCampaign is in progress.
COMPLETEDCampaign has completed.
NOT_STARTEDCampaign has not begun.
 

 

## Catalog product group type
Value Description
MERCHANT_CREATEDMerchant-created product group.
ALL_PRODUCTSAuto-created all products product group.
BEST_DEALSAuto-created product group for most discounted on sale products.
PINNER_FAVORITESAuto-created product group for top items based on Pinterest engagement (ads + organic).
TOP_SELLERSAuto-created product group for the top items based on Tag Conversion data.
BACK_IN_STOCKAuto-created product group for the items that were previously out of stock.
NEW_ARRIVALSAuto-created product group for the items that were newly added to Catalogs.
 

 

## Conversion event

Conversion events are specific actions someone takes on your website. These events are tracked with a Pinterest tag.

Value Description
ADD_TO_CARTItems added to shopping carts.
APP_INSTALLApp installations.
CHECKOUTCompleted transactions.
CUSTOMTracking for a special event that you want to include in your conversion reporting.
LEADInterest in product or service.
PAGE_VISITViews of your primary pages, such as product pages and article pages.
SEARCHWebsite searches.
SIGNUPSign ups for your products or services.
VIEW_CATEGORYCategory page views.
WATCH_VIDEOVideo views.
 

 

## Conversion tag type
Value Description
ADD_TO_CARTTracks items added to shopping carts.
APP_INSTALLTracks app installations.
CHECKOUTTracks completed transactions.
CUSTOMTracking for a special event that you want to include in your conversion reporting.
LEADTracks interest in product or service.
INITIALIZED
PAGE_LOADTracks when page is loaded.
PAGE_UNLOADTracks when page is unloaded.
PAGE_VISITTracks views of your primary pages, such as product pages and article pages.
SEARCHTracks website searches.
SIGNUPTracks sign-ups for your products or services.
VIEW_CATEGORYTracks category page views.
WATCH_VIDEOTracks video views.
 

 

## Conversion learning mode type.
Value Description
ACTIVEActive.
NOT_ACTIVENot active.
 

 

## Creative type

A campaign's creative type is an immutable field that restricts the types of eligible pins for the campaign. For example, in a "CINEMATIC" only campaign, non cinematic pin promotions are suspended.

Value Description
APPDefault creative type for APP_INSTALL objective. Generally available.
APP_VIDEONot in use.
BOARDDeprecated.
CAROUSELMulti-image format. Generally available.
CINEMATICDeprecated.
COMMERCEDeprecated.
MAX_VIDEOHigh impact video format. Generally available.
NATIVE_VIDEODeprecated.
REGULARSingle image format. Generally available.
SEARCH_PROMINENCEDeprecated.
SEARCH_PROMINENCE_CAROUSELDeprecated.
SHOP_THE_PINMulti-image format featuring a hero image and corresponding chips. Beta.
SHOPPINGSingle image format for catalog sales objective. Generally available.
THIRD_PARTYDeprecated.
VIDEOStandard video format. Generally available.
 

 

## Entity status

An entity can be a campaign, an ad group, or pin promotions.

Value Description
ACTIVEEntity active.
ARCHIVEDEntity archived.
PAUSEDEntity paused.
 

 

## Entity type
Value Description
AD_GROUPAd group entity.
ADVERTISERAdvertiser entity.
BILLBill entity.
CAMPAIGNCampaign entity
PIN_PROMOTIONPin promotion entity.
PRODUCT_GROUPProduct group entity.
 

 

## Entity version
Value Description
LEGACYOld object model.
NEW_ENTITY_MODELNew object model.
 

 

## Match type (keyword).

For more information, see keyword targeting.

Value Description
BROADPins show for your own keyword as well as for misspellings, synonyms, and other related search terms. Word order does not matter.
EXACTPins show on your exact keyword or on a close variation of that keyword. Word order matters.
EXACT_NEGATIVEYour Pins will not show on a search that matches your keyword exactly. Order matters.
PHRASEPins show on search terms that include the entire phrased contained in the specified keyword as well as misspellings and close variations of that phrase. The search term phrase must use the same word order as the keyword. For example, "decor" > "home decor" or vice-versa.
PHRASE_NEGATIVEYour Pins will not show on any search that contains the entire keyword phrase within the search term. Word order matters.
 

 

## Metric types
Value Description
CLICKTHROUGHPin link clicks.
CLICKTHROUGH_RATEDaily pin link clicks.
CLOSEUPHow many times the pin has been clicked to close up and takes over the screen (full page pin view).
CLOSEUP_RATEDaily closeup rate.
ENGAGEMENTPin interactions including saves, closeups, and link clicks.
ENGAGEMENT_RATE Daily engagment rate.
IMPRESSIONPin views including in-feed views, follower views, etc.
SAVEPin saves by other users.
SAVE_RATE Daily pin save rate.
 

 

## Mobile measurement partner type

Third party partners. Go to their websites listed below for more information.

Value Description
ADJUSTadjust.com/
APPSFLYERappsflyer.com/
APSALARapsalar.com/
BRANCHbranch.io
KOCHAVAkochava.com/
TUNEtune.com/
 

 

## Pacing delivery type
Value Description
ACCELERATEDAn Ad group budget is spent as fast as possible.
STANDARDAn Ad group budget is spent smoothly over a day.
 

 

## Pin formats
Value Description
productShopping pins but not including shop the look (stl) pins.
standardAll other pins not categorized as stl, product, video, or story.
standard_product_stl_unionStandard plus stl.
standard_product_unionStandard and product
standard_stl_unionStandard and stl.
stlShop the look pins let people find fashion and home decor products. When clicked, white dots appear that tag different parts of the look. People can tap the dots to view and shop exact or similar products featured in the pin.
storyA story pin has information about making a recipe or craft, and can contain up to 20 pages of images and text.
videoPinterest video pins.
 

 

## Pin promotion review status
Value Description
APPROVEDPin promotion approved.
OTHERReserved for unexpected cases.
PENDINGPin promotion under review.
REJECTEDPin promotion rejected.
 

 

## Pin promotion status
Value Description
ACTIVEPin promotion approved.
OTHERReserved for unexpected cases.
PAUSEDPin promotion paused.
 

 

## Pinner (audience) list type
Value Description
ACTALIKE People similar to one of your existing audiences.
ENGAGEMENTPeople who've previously engaged with Pins from your website. These engagements include pin clicks, saves, closeups, comments and likes.
LOOKALIKEPeople who look and act similar to your audience.
USER_LISTCustomer list created from uploading existing customers' emails or other mobile ad IDs (MAIDs)
VISITORPeople who've visited your site - tracked with the Pinterest tag.
 

 

## Placement
Value Description
BOARD_OTHERS
BOARD_SELF
CATEGORY
EXPLORE
FLASHLIGHT
HOME_FEED
INTERESTS
KLP
NEWS_HUB
OTHER
RELATED_PINS
SEARCH
STORIES
USER_LIKES
USER_PINS
 

 

### Placement exclusion
Value Description
BROWSEDon't show ad in browse results.
OTHERCustom placement exclusion.
RELATED_PINSDon't show promoted pin in related pins.
SEARCHDoni't show promoted pin in search results.
SEARCH_AND_RELATED_PINSDon't show promoted pin in search results and related pins.
 

 

## Placement group
Value Description
ALLShow promoted pin in all placements. Default.
BROWSEShow promoted pin as people browse in their home feed.
OTHERCustom placement.
SEARCHShow promoted pin in search results.
 

 

## Tracking URL event
Value Description
IMPRESSIONImpression event.
ENGAGEMENTEngagement event.
CLICKClick event.
BUYABLE_BUTTONBuy button event.
AUDIENCE_VERIFICATIONAudience verification event.
 

 

## User list type
Value Description
EMAILEmail as identifier.
IDFA The Identifier for Advertisers (IDFA) is a random device identifier assigned by Apple to a user's device. The IDFA can also identify when users interact with a mobile advertising campaign, provided the channel offers IDFA tracking and the advertiser tracks users who interact with ads successfully.
MAID The Mobile Ad ID (MAID) is a generic term for hexadecimal digit strings that Android or Apple assigns to a mobile device.
LR_IDLiveRamp ID.
DLX_IDDatalogix ID.
 

 

## User role
Value Description
ADMINCan add or remove people and create or edit anything in the account such as campaigns, spend limits, bids, budgets, audiences and more. Can do everything an owner can do except change the owner.
ANALYSTCan only view ad account data to create reports.
AUDIENCE_MANAGERCan create or edit audiences and view existing Pinterest tags.
CAMPAIGN_MANAGERCan create and edit campaigns, ad groups and Promoted Pins, pull reports, and create and delete Pins on protected boards for promotion purposes.
CATALOGS_MANAGERCan create and edit data source and product group information.
FINANCE_MANAGERCan edit billing information.
OWNERCan do everything.
 

 

## Video pin metric types
Value Description
CLICKTHROUGHPin link clicks.
IMPRESSIONTotal impressions
QUARTILE_95_PERCENT_VIEWTotal 95% views.
SAVETotal saves.
VIDEO_10S_VIEWTotal 10-second views.
VIDEO_AVG_WATCH_TIME The average time people watched your video. This includes people who rewatch your video in the same day.
VIDEO_MRC_VIEWTotal video views.
VIDEO_STARTTotal number of video starts.
VIDEO_V50_WATCH_TIMETotal watch time (minutes).
 

 

## Visibility group
Value Description
MANAGED_KEYWORDPinterest-managed keyword campaign
MANAGED_SHOPPINGPinterest-managed shopping campaign.
MANAGED_RESERVATIONVIDEOPinterest-managed reservation video campaign.
REMOVE
